code: library(jamsession); some_object <- data.frame(A=LETTERS[1:10]); save_jamsession("jamsessionVignette",    sessions_path=tempdir()); #> ##------ Mon Nov 17 17:56:31 2025 ------## #> ##  (17:56:31) 17Nov2025:   save_jamsession(): Saved jamsession 'jamsessionVignette' to sessions_path 'C:\Users\JAMES~1.WAR\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSSHQA4'  #> ##  (17:56:31) 17Nov2025:   save_jamsession(): session_file:C:\Users\JAMES~1.WAR\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSSHQA4/inProgress_jamsessionVignette_17nov2025.RData x <- rnorm(90); y <- matrix(ncol=9, data=x); ## Usually only run like this: # save_jamsession();  ## For this vignette we add sessions_path save_jamsession("jamsessionVignette",    sessions_path=tempdir()); #> ##------ Mon Nov 17 17:56:31 2025 ------## #> ##  (17:56:31) 17Nov2025:   save_jamsession(): Saved jamsession 'jamsessionVignette' to sessions_path 'C:\Users\JAMES~1.WAR\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSSHQA4'  #> ##  (17:56:32) 17Nov2025:   save_jamsession(): session_file:C:\Users\JAMES~1.WAR\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSSHQA4/inProgress_jamsessionVignette_17nov2025.RData rm(y); load_jamsession("jamsessionVignette",    sessions_path=tempdir()); #> ##  (17:56:32) 17Nov2025:   load_jamsession(): Loading session: C:/Users/JAMES~1.WAR/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpSSHQA4/inProgress_jamsessionVignette_17nov2025.RData  #> ##  (17:56:32) 17Nov2025:   load_jamsession(): Loaded session:jamsessionVignette into environment 'R_GlobalEnv'  #> ##  (17:56:32) 17Nov2025:   load_jamsession(): jamba::setPrompt() print(head(y)); title: Introduction to jamsession
text: R functional programming language, makes especially useful powerful write re-use custom functions. R analysts built long list useful helper functions, either re-use across projects, written specifically per project. Either way, functions need loaded R workspace, likely need refreshed functions updated time. demonstrate utility script creating temporary script, using refresh_functions(). Now file saved name “jamsession”. can load file refresh_functions(). vignette, include argument functions_path=tempdir(), argument usually necessary, functions saved common path. Run jamvignette_paths() see set expected paths. Lastly, can run printfun() function show works.
code: ## Create a simple R script function fun() r_script <- " #' Simple print function #'  #' This function simply runs print() #' #' @param x any R object that can be printed. #' @param ... additional arguments are passed to print(). #' #' @export printfun <- function(x, ...) {print(x, ...)}; ";  ## Save to a file in tempdir fn_file <- file.path(tempdir(),    "jamvignette_functions.R"); ## Save the R script to a file cat(r_script, file=fn_file); ## Load the R script refresh_functions("jamvignette",    functions_path=tempdir()); #> ✔ Creating C:/Users/JAMES~1.WAR/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpSSHQA4/jamvignette/. #> ✔ Setting active project to #>   "C:/Users/james.ward/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpSSHQA4/jamvignette". #> ✔ Creating R/. #> ✔ Writing DESCRIPTION. #> ✔ Writing NAMESPACE. #> ✔ Setting active project to "<no active project>". #> ##  (17:56:33) 17Nov2025:   refresh_functions(): Loaded temporary package as 'jamvignette'  ## search() shows the environments including jamvignette print(search()); #>  [1] ".GlobalEnv"          "devtools_shims"      "package:jamvignette" #>  [4] "package:jamsession"  "package:stats"       "package:graphics"    #>  [7] "package:grDevices"   "package:utils"       "package:datasets"    #> [10] "package:methods"     "Autoloads"           "tools:callr"         #> [13] "package:base"  ## find() to show where printfun is located find("printfun") #> [1] "package:jamvignette" printfun(LETTERS[1:10]); #>  [1] "A" "B" "C" "D" "E" "F" "G" "H" "I" "J"

Remember use most_recent=FALSE searching past versions stored R objects. ignore.case logical passed grep() indicating whether ignore upper lower case, default ignore.case=TRUE. return_df logical indicating whether return data.frame. most_recent logical whether return recent saved version matching object, default most_recent=TRUE. Note returns recent matching object. verbose logical whether print verbose output ... additional arguments passed grepl(). objects_path character vector one file paths search saved R objects. objects_path=NULL, uses output jamsession_paths()$objects.

NULL, uses output jamsession_paths()$sessions. return_df logical whether return vector (FALSE) data.frame (TRUE) detailed information session. sort_by_date logical whether sort results date, opposed order retrieved list.files. ignore.case logical sent grep, default TRUE searches case-insensitive mode. most_recent logical whether return recent saved version matching session, default TRUE. argument passed list_jamsessions(). include_attrs logical indicating whether include attributes "file_path", "file_size", "save_date", "days_old", used return_df=FALSE. add_stats logical indicating whether include summary stats session: number_saved number past versions session; total_size total file size saved versions. remove_pattern, replacement arguments passed clean_jamsession_name(). verbose logical indicating whether print verbose output. ... additional arguments passed list_jamessions(), jamba::provigrep(), relevent. session_prefix session_suffix customized, done .

title: jamsession file paths — jamsession_paths
text: function retrieves file path jamsession type: 'sessions': folder R sessions saved, stored getOption("jam.sessions_path"), default "~/Projects/R-sessions". 'objects': folder R objects saved, stored getOption("jam.objects_path"), default "~/Projects/R-objects". 'functions': folder R functions saved, stored getOption("jam.functions_path"), default "~/Projects/R-scripts". may multiple paths, may contain "." include current working directory. use persistent values R environment, define options() ~/.Rprofile HOME directory, folder active project. use custom file paths R session, use either ~/.Rprofile appropriate method define relevant options. options("jam.sessions_path"="//path/sessions"), options("jam.objects_path"="//path/objects"), options("jam.functions_path"="//path/functions").

title: jamsession file paths — jamsession_paths
code: ## Display the current or default paths c(jamsession_paths(functions=NULL)) #> $sessions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-sessions" #>  #> $objects #> [1] "~/Projects/R-objects" #>  #> $functions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-scripts" #>   ## Update the functions path jamsession_paths(functions="~/Projects/R-functions") #> $sessions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-sessions" #>  #> $objects #> [1] "~/Projects/R-objects" #>  #> $functions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-functions" #>   ## confirm the functions path has been updated c(jamsession_paths()) #> $sessions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-sessions" #>  #> $objects #> [1] "~/Projects/R-objects" #>  #> $functions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-functions" #>  getOption("jam.functions_path") #> [1] "~/Projects/R-functions"  ## Revert the functions path c(jamsession_paths(functions="~/Projects/R-scripts")) #> $sessions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-sessions" #>  #> $objects #> [1] "~/Projects/R-objects" #>  #> $functions #> [1] "~/Projects/R-scripts" #>

'list': returns list . ... additional arguments ignored.

Available functions defined files suffix '_functions.R'. possible supply multiple file paths using argument functions_path. functions returned, sorted save_date, order functions_path. file saved date returned first entry functions_path. using most_recent=TRUE, first entry returned unique value 'functions' column, ordered 'save_date' 'functions_path'.

title: List functions file exports — list_functions_exports
text: List functions file exports, experimental, dependent upon R file using roxygen2 style '@exports'. .R files use roxygen2 comments return information.

title: List functions file exports — list_functions_exports
code: list_functions_exports(grep_string, debug = FALSE, ...)

title: List functions file exports — list_functions_exports
text: grep_string character passed grep_functions() default values except provided via '...' arguments. debug logical default FALSE, whether print debug information illustrate processing. ... arguments passed grep_functions()

title: List functions file exports — list_functions_exports
text: list named matching functions files, character vector matching function exported object .R file.

title: List functions file exports — list_functions_exports
text: process looks break roxygen2 comments R file. Specific steps described: splits lines file point non-roxygen2 line immediately followed roxygen2 line. Within block, confirms line begins : #' @export. line, block ignored. Within remaining blocks, looks first non-roxygen2 line contains alphabetic character, also '#' occurring alphabetic character. returns one line "exported object" block. example simple roxygen2 style R function shown :   example , results :
code: #' Function Name #' #' @export function_name <- function (argument1, argument2, ...) {    # function code }  #' Another Function Name #' #' @export another_function <- function (argument1, argument2, ...) {    # function code }  #' Data object #' @docType data "Object_name" "function_name <- function" "another_function <- function" "Object_name"

title: List saved R sessions — list_jamsessions
text: sessions_path character vector one file paths search saved R sessions. NULL, uses output jamsession_paths()$sessions. most_recent logical default FALSE, whether return recent entry session name. most_recent FALSE saved versions returned R session names. session_prefix, session_suffix character string used prefix suffix searching path sessions_path matching file names. add_stats logical indicating whether include summary stats session: number_saved number past versions session; total_size total file size saved versions. ... additional parameters ignored

title: List saved R sessions — list_jamsessions

title: List saved R sessions — list_jamsessions
text: function lists available saved R sessions, usually called grep_jamsessions(). most_recent=TRUE returns recent session based upon save_date. possible supply multiple file paths using argument sessions_path, case sessions returned directories, sorted save_date. input sessions_path stored ordered factor, two sessions save_date still ordered consistent input directories sessions_path. case, most_recent=TRUE one entry returned per object name, first entry recent entry ordered save_date sessions_path. practice, recommended use one sessions_path location, option exists. example, jamsession(grep_sessions("my_session")) load recent session save_date ties prefer order sessions_path. Similarly, load_jamsession("my_session") thing, without grep_patten search step.

title: load an R session — load_jamsession
text: session character string corresponding "session", matched directly "session" column output grep_jamsessions(), data.frame output grep_jamsessions(). value can also match rownames() list_jamsessions() can include specific 'save_date'. sessions_path character vector one file paths search saved R sessions. NULL, uses output jamsession_paths()$session. value used session character vector, passed grep_jamsessions(). save_date optional character string specific date use loading session. Note argument 'session' can accept string suffix, 'sessionname_savedate'. string matched "save_date" returned list_jamsessions(). save_date NULL, recent session used, default behavior. envir environment, "environment" %% class(envir). default envir uses globalenv() loads R session workspace. behavior intended new R sessions, restore R session state R session saved. loading active R session, envir defined separate environment, order prevent R objects R session file overwriting R objects name local R workspace. example session_env=new.env();load_jamsession("New", envir=session_env). assign_session logical default TRUE, whether assign session parent.env(), typically global environment globalenv(). load_history logical default TRUE, whether load '.Rhistory' file R session, available. do_prompt logical default TRUE, whether set R prompt jamba::setPrompt() include session name. do_window_title logical default TRUE, whether update graphics device options include session name title. TRUE, calls quartz.options(), X11.options(), windows.options() available. verbose logical whether print verbose output. ... additional arguments passed jamba::setPrompt().

Note loading R history overwrite previous active R history. However, envir defined something globalenv(), prompt altered, R session loaded specific environment. case R history loaded, even load_history=TRUE. assign_session=TRUE environment assigned new object globalenv() can attached attach().

title: load R object by name — load_object
text: object character string indicating name R object load, data.frame output grep_objects() contains colnames ("object", "object_path", "object_file"). save_date optional character string specific date use loading object. string matched "save_date" returned list_objects(). save_date NULL, recent object loaded, default behavior. objects_path character vector one file paths search saved R objects. objects_path=NULL, uses output jamsession_paths()$objects. envir optional R environment inside load R object. Note R object already exists environment, overwritten without warning. behavior intended load_object(). verbose logical whether print verbose output ... additional arguments ignored.

title: load R object by name — load_object
text: invisible name R object loaded. also loads R object environment specified, default active global environment .GlobalEnv.

title: load R object by name — load_object
text: function loads recently saved R object name, given file path. mechanism intended help share useful R objects across R sessions, especially may helpful discover R objects name, R objects may continue useful time. Typically function called name one saved objects, loads recent version . However, argument save_date can supplied vector, recycled saved object, method load specific version object. behavior intended routine use, available rare cases may want inspect previous versions object. Note envir can used load object separate environment, needed.

title: load R object by name — load_object
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  withr::with_options(list(jam.objects_path=tempdir()), {  my_df <- data.frame(col1=LETTERS[1:5], col2=letters[1:5]); print(my_df);  save_object("my_df", verbose=FALSE);  print(grep_objects("my_df"))  rm(my_df);  load_object("my_df", verbose=FALSE); print(my_df);  load_object(grep_objects("my_df"), verbose=FALSE) print(my_df); })  ###################################### # Load into a separate environment rm(my_df); sep_env <- new.env();  withr::with_options(list(jam.objects_path=tempdir()), {  load_object("my_df", envir=sep_env, verbose=FALSE)  # this object is not in the current workspace print(find("sep_env"))  # you can use get() to see this object print(get("my_df", envir=sep_env));  })  ###################################### # example showing two objects stored together withr::with_options(list(jam.objects_path=tempdir()), { my_df2 <- data.frame(B=LETTERS[11:15], b=letters[11:15]);  load_object("my_df", verbose=FALSE); save_object(c("my_df", "my_df2"), verbose=FALSE);  print(grep_objects("my_df2")) loaded <- load_object(grep_objects("my_df2"), verbose=FALSE);  # note that it loads two objects print(loaded); }) }

Otherwise, values getOption("usethis.description") modified default_defaults=TRUE. R package temporary, defaults little actual impact. Just sure edit DESCRIPTION file intend use R package long term. pkg_suffix NULL character string used suffix, appended end temporary package name. pkg_suffix pkg_name useful avoid name conflicts proper R packages. example "igraph_functions.R" loaded "igraph" else conflict actual "igraph" R package. use_tempdir character path, function returns valid file path suitable create subdirectory temporary R package. default base::tempdir() returns single temporary directory R session, note directory may deleted R session ended. verbose logical indicating whether print verbose output. ... additional arguments ignored.

Note function refresh_functions() validate .R file, check whether R file valid part R package. However, refresh_functions() also calls roxygen2::roxygenize(), inherits lot validation process display error messages relevant. point, error messages intended good thing make syntax errors visible. Note function remove temporary R package directory, assumes use_tempdir defined base::tempdir(), see function help information. title: Load or refresh R file functions as a temporary package — refresh_functions
code: # create two temporary functions tempfn <- function(x){x} another_tempfn <- function(x){length(x)}  # save these functions to a temporary file # tempfns_functions.R tempfn_file <- file.path(tempdir(), "tempfns_functions.R"); dump(c("tempfn", "another_tempfn"), file=tempfn_file);  # remove the functions from the environment rm(tempfn); rm(another_tempfn);  # load the functions refresh_functions("tempfns", functions_path=tempdir()) #> ✔ Creating C:/Users/JAMES~1.WAR/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmp2N4Xv5/tempfns/. #> ✔ Setting active project to #>   "C:/Users/james.ward/AppData/Local/Temp/Rtmp2N4Xv5/tempfns". #> ✔ Creating R/. #> ✔ Writing DESCRIPTION. #> ✔ Writing NAMESPACE. #> ✔ Setting active project to "<no active project>". #> ##  (17:56:28) 17Nov2025:   refresh_functions(): Loaded temporary package as 'tempfns'   # the tempfn() function is now inside a package find("tempfn") #> [1] "package:tempfns" #> package:tempfns  # the function can be called tempfn(c("one", "two")) #> [1] "one" "two" #> [1] "one" "two"

title: version 0.0.3.900
text: refresh_functions() matching exact start filename, allowing suffix matches expected filename, example "DM" matched "DM" "JDM". updated force match full filename, intended behavior.

title: version 0.0.2.900
text: save_jamsession() new arguments save list objects stored RData file. Future idea enable searching sessions object name. may useful working particularly large R session files, sometimes several GB size even compression. save_objectlist=TRUE enable saving text file list R objects saved RData session. objectlist_suffix=".objectlist.txt" defines filename suffix use output file. save_jamsession() now calls clean_jamsession_name() prepare session name convert file-friendly format saving session file RData format. function also changes logic somewhat allows underscore "_" longer converts hyphen "-". grep_jamsessions() also uses clean_jamsession_name() order process session names consistently, initial session name can still used successfully find saved session.

title: version 0.0.2.900
text: clean_jamsession_name() - function takes session name removes unwanted characters converts underscore "_" default. allow custom modification pattern matching, replacement character.

Added helper function show_session_versions() Added helper function print_pkg_description() initial release already accomplished major goal transitioning away using source() sys.source() load R functions, instead creates temporary R package.
